fields.description: Identify the Effective Date of the agreement when the terms start to apply.

fields.prompt: Effective Date

fields.description:
Return the facility types mentioned in the document (Term Loan, Revolving Loan).
This information is typically found in Section 2.

lines.prompt: Return as a list.

fields.name: Facility Type
fields.prompt:
Identify the facility types mentioned in the document, specifically Term Loan and Revolving Loan, typically found in Section 2.

Return only facility types(term loan or revolving loan), nothing else.

fields.description: Extract the complete definition of the "Applicable Margin", containing percentage value in their definitions.

lines.prompt: Return only the Pricing Options and their corresponding spread Rates per annum as a list.
Remove duplicates

fields.name: Spread Rate
fields.prompt: Spread Rate

fields.description: Extract the Governing Law, indicating the jurisdiction whose laws govern the agreement.

lines.prompt: Return the state laws as a list.

fields.name: Governing Law
fields.prompt: Extract the "Governing Law" specified in the credit agreement document. Look for sections or clauses that define the legal jurisdiction or the state, country, or region whose laws will govern the interpretation and enforcement of the agreement.

fields.description:
The borrower's name in a credit agreement is the name of the person or entity that is borrowing money or another item.
The borrower's name is typically found in the introductory sections

lines.prompt: multiple names
N/A if no value present

fields.name: Borrower Names
fields.prompt: Borrower Names

fields.description:
Extract the Accrual Basis in days from the document, corresponding to each loan type or pricing option.
Identify references to 360, 365, or 366 days for each pricing option mentioned.

lines.prompt:
Return in table format (Borrowing loan & Accrual Basis in days).
Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.name: Accrual Basis
fields.prompt:
Return the types of pricing options specified by the borrower, such as ABR, Eurodollar, typically mentioned in section 2.
Don't return the facility types like Term loan & Revolving Loan.

Then, return the Accrual Basis in days (360, 365, or 366) for each pricing option mentioned in the interest payment dates section.

fields.description: Identify the Business Date Convention, specifying how business days are defined or adjusted for the purposes of the agreement.

lines.prompt: Return only one Convention Used either ('Next Succeeding Business Day,' 'Previous Business Day,' 'Next Succeeding Business Day Unless Next Month,' or 'Due Same Day').

fields.name: Business Day Adjustment
fields.prompt:
Return the Business Date Convention, specifying how business days are defined or adjusted for the purposes of the agreement.
Possible values like 'Next Succeeding Business Day,' 'Previous Business Day,' 'Next Succeeding Business Day Unless Next Month,' or 'Due Same Day.'

fields.description: Extract all the types of agents mentioned in the credit agreement document, such as "Administrative Agent," "Collateral Agent," "Syndication Agent," and "Documentation Agent" along with the banks as the agents.

lines.prompt: Return as a list (agents types and org names).

fields.name: Agents
fields.prompt: Agents

prompt_schema.description: Look for terms like "Agent," "Arrangers," or "Administrative Agent.
prompt_schema.name: Agent description

lines.prompt: Return the pricing options as a list.

fields.name: Pricing Options
fields.prompt: Pricing Options

fields.description: The date by which the entire loan amount must be repaid
fields.name: Maturity Date
fields.prompt: Maturity Date

fields.description:
First extract the types of pricing options specified by the borrower, such as ABR, Eurodollar, typically mentioned in section 2.
Don't return the facility types like Term loan & Revolving Loan.

Then for each pricing option extract the definition from the definition section.

lines.prompt: Return in a list format( pricing options & definitions).

fields.name: Pricing Option Definition
fields.prompt:
First extract the types of pricing options names specified by the borrower, such as ABR, Eurodollar, typically mentioned in section 2.
Don't return the facility types like Term loan & Revolving Loan. 

Then, return the complete definitions related to the pricing options names only mentioned in the definition section.
Focus on definitions that are under headings including terms related to the pricing options, and look for suffixes such as "rate," "loans", "base rate", or the full form of the pricing options.

fields.description: Extract the "All-In Rate Floor" value from the credit agreement. This value represents the minimum total interest rate, including all applicable fees and costs, specified in the document.

lines.prompt: Return as a table (Pricing Option names & All in Rate)

fields.name: All in rate Floor
fields.prompt:
First extract the types of pricing options names specified by the borrower, such as ABR, Eurodollar, typically mentioned in section 2.
Don't return the facility types like Term loan & Revolving Loan. 

Then, return the complete definitions related to the pricing options names only mentioned in the definition section.
Focus on definitions that are under headings including terms related to the pricing options, and look for suffixes such as "rate," "loan", "base rate", or the full form of the pricing option.

From each definition, find the first decimal percentage value. If no numerical rate is found, return 'NA'.

fields.description: x

lines.prompt:
Return facility type and its corresponding bill types as a list.
Return only interest if principal is not present.

fields.name: Bill Type
fields.prompt:
Identify the facility types mentioned in the document, specifically Term Loan and Revolving Loan, typically found in Section 2. Return only the facility types (Term Loan or Revolving Loan).

Then, for each facility type, find whether both interest and principal are used for repayment, or only interest.

fields.description:
Return the frequency(monthly, quarterly, or annually) for interest and principal payments.

For Interest Payments, refer to the Interest section, specifically under Accrued Interest or in Interest Payment Date definitions, to determine the frequency of interest payments(monthly, quarterly, or annually).

For Principal Payments, refer to the "Repayment of loans" section and identify the frequency of principal payments. If the frequency is not explicitly mentioned, refer to the table given in the repayment of loans section and compute the frequency(monthly, quarterly, or annually).

lines.prompt: Return as a table (Pricing Option & frequency).

fields.name: Interest Frequency
fields.prompt:
Return the interest payment dates for the pricing option typically mentioned in the "interest", "interest payment date", "interest  date" definition.
The specific dates on which interest payments are due.
Then, determine the frequency of interest repayments (e.g., monthly, quarterly, annually).

fields.description: Principal Amount

lines.prompt: Return the principal amount or percentage.

fields.name: Principal Bill Amount
fields.prompt: Return the principal amount for principal repayments mentioned in repayment of loans sections.

fields.description:
Extract the Repayment date for interest payment specified in the credit agreement document. 
Look in the Interest section or in Interest Payment Date definitions. Identify the dates when interest payments are due.

lines.prompt: Return as a table (pricing options & payment dates).

fields.name: Interest Due Date
fields.prompt:
Return the interest payment dates for the pricing options typically mentioned in the "interest" or "interest payment date" definition.
The specific dates on which interest payments are due.

fields.description:
First, extract the complete content of the repayment of loans section.

Then, return the principal payment due dates for the pricing options. 

There will be two ways in which the dates will be mentioned either in text form or in tables.

lines.prompt: Return the due dates as a list. Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.name: Principal Bill Due Date
fields.prompt: Return the principal payment dates for the pricing options from the repayment of loans section.

fields.description: Always found in Fees / Unused commitment fees section

lines.prompt: Return only fee effective date.

fields.name: Fee Effective Date
fields.prompt:
It would generally be after "during the period from" text in the fee section.
Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.description: Extract the "Principal Bill Frequency" from the credit agreement document. Focus on the "Repayment of Loans" section, "Principal Payment Schedule," or any related tables that specify how often principal payments are required (e.g., monthly, quarterly, annually).

lines.prompt: Return only frequency. Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.name: Principal Bill Frequency
fields.prompt: Return the frequency for principal payments (monthly, quarterly, annually) mentioned in the repayment of loans section.

fields.description: Fee Rate
fields.name: Fee Rate
fields.prompt: Fee Rate

fields.description: CFee Amount Fixed

lines.prompt: Return the fee Amount. Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.name: Fixed Fee Amount
fields.prompt: Fixed Commitment Fee Amount

fields.description: It would generally be after "excluding" text in the fee section.

lines.prompt: Return only fee expiration date.

fields.name: Fee Expiration Date
fields.prompt:
It would generally be after "excluding" text in the commitment fee section.
Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.description: Return the date before which the agents and lenders shall receive the fees.

lines.prompt: Return the fee payment date. Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.name: Fee Payment Date
fields.prompt: Identify the payment dates for agents and lenders to receive the commitment fees from the commitment fee section.

fields.description: Identify the frequency of fee payments (e.g., Monthly, Quarterly, Annually) from the fee section.

lines.prompt: Return only frequency. Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.name: Fee Payment Frequency
fields.prompt: Identify the frequency of fee payments (e.g., Monthly, Quarterly, Annually) from the commitment fee section.

fields.description: return the Accrual Basis in days (360, 365, or 366) for each pricing option mentioned in the document.

lines.prompt: Return the value.

fields.name: Fee Accrual Basis
fields.prompt:
Return the Accrual Basis in days (360, 365, or 366) for fee payments from the commitment fee section.
Return 'NA' if not found.

fields.description: Extract the methodology for analyzing the interest coverage ratio from the credit agreement. Detail how EBITDA is calculated according to the agreement. Additionally, determine if the agreement specifies referencing the most recent 10-K filing for automatic calculation of these metrics, and how this is to be implemented.
fields.name: EBITDA
fields.prompt: How is EBITDA calculated?

fields.description: EBITDA to Debt ratio to be maintained by the borrower generally mentioned in the negative covenants section.
fields.name: EBITDA to Debt ratio
fields.prompt: EBITDA to Debt ratio

fields.description: how is interest coverage ratio analyzed?
fields.name: Interest Coverage Ratio
fields.prompt: How is interest coverage ratio analyzed?

5618.docstring:
Validates the 'Maturity Date' field.

    Fields:
    - Maturity Date: Expected to be a string representing a date in various formats such as:
      * '17/12/2024'
      * 'March 8, 2018'
      * '2015'
      * '2019'
      * 'December 8, 2025'
      * 'September 30, 2024'
      * 'September 30, 2025'

    The function checks if the 'Maturity Date' is in a valid format. If it is not, it returns a specific error message.
    If the date is valid, it returns None.

examples.description: Base case: Valid date format in DD/MM/YYYY.
Base case: Valid date format with full month name and day, year.
Base case: Valid date format with full month name and day, year.
Base case: Valid date format with full month name and day, year.
Base case: Valid date format with full month name and day, year.
Invalid case: Incorrect date format with hyphens instead of slashes.
Invalid case: Incorrect date format with ordinal suffix 'th'.
Invalid case: Incorrect date format with day first instead of month.
Invalid case: Incorrect date format with year first and hyphens.
Invalid case: Incorrect date format with year first and slashes.
Invalid case: Incorrect date format with ordinal suffix 'th' and day first.
Invalid case: Incorrect date format with year first and hyphens.

5618.function_code:
import dateparser
    import re
    date_formats = ['^\\d{2}/\\d{2}/\\d{4}$', '^\\w+ \\d{1,2}, \\d{4}$', '^\\d{4}$', '^\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}$', '^\\d{2}-\\d{2}-\\d{4}$', '^\\d{4}/\\d{2}/\\d{2}$', '^\\d{1,2}(st|nd|rd|th) \\w+ \\d{4}$']
    if not any((re.match(fmt, Maturity_Date) for fmt in date_formats)):
        return "Invalid date format for 'Maturity Date'."
    parsed_date = dateparser.parse(Maturity_Date)
    if not parsed_date:
        return "Invalid date format for 'Maturity Date'."
    return None
5618.name: validate_maturity_date
